security_audit.summary: Legitimate spreadsheet manipulation skill. Uses subprocess to invoke LibreOffice for formula recalculation with hardcoded arguments. All subprocess calls are constrained to specific LibreOffice commands. No network activity or file exfiltration capability. Risk is limited to local file operations on user-specified Excel files.

content.value_statement: Need to build financial models or analyze spreadsheet data? This skill creates Excel files with formulas, formatting, and data analysis. It recalculates formulas automatically to ensure accuracy.
actual_capabilities: Create new Excel files with formulas, formatting, and styling
Edit existing spreadsheets while preserving formulas and formatting
Analyze data using pandas for statistics and manipulation
Recalculate all formulas using LibreOffice integration
Apply industry-standard color coding for financial models
limitations: Cannot create or edit macros (VBA code)
Large files may require read_only or write_only modes

output: Created expense_tracker.xlsx with columns: Category, January, February, March
Added SUM formulas for row totals and column grand totals
Applied color coding: blue for input cells, black for formulas
Recalculated all formulas successfully - zero errors
Created revenue_model.xlsx with assumptions in separate cells
Applied blue text for inputs, black text for formulas, green for cross-sheet links
Verified all formulas with recalc.py - no errors found

best_practices: Always use Excel formulas instead of hardcoding calculated values to maintain spreadsheet flexibility
Place all assumptions in separate cells with clear labels and source documentation
Run recalc.py to verify formulas after creating or modifying spreadsheets
anti_patterns: Hardcoding calculated values instead of using Excel formulas
Opening files with data_only=True when you need to preserve formulas
Forgetting to recalculate formulas after creating or editing spreadsheets

faq.question: Does this skill work with .csv and .tsv files?
faq.answer: Yes, pandas can read and write CSV and TSV files. For full formula support, use .xlsx format.

faq.question: Why do I need LibreOffice for formula recalculation?
faq.answer: Openpyxl preserves formulas but does not calculate their values. LibreOffice calculates formulas accurately.

faq.question: Can this skill edit existing Excel templates?
faq.answer: Yes, load_workbook preserves existing formulas and formatting while allowing modifications.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill only operates on files you explicitly specify. No data is sent over the network.

faq.question: What Excel errors can this skill detect?
faq.answer: It detects #VALUE!, #DIV/0!, #REF!, #NAME?, #NULL!, #NUM!, and #N/A errors with their locations.

faq.question: How is this different from using pandas alone?
faq.answer: Pandas is ideal for data analysis. This skill uses openpyxl for formula preservation and LibreOffice for accurate formula calculation.
